website_summaries.verdict: It's a nutritionally-balanced food formulated just for puppies, but it's a pricey investment for a bag of dog food if your pup doesn't like it.
pros: An easily digestible formula that combines roasted bison and venison for quality protein that puppies need
Pellets are smaller than adult-sized formulas to suit puppies of all sizes
cons: Owners report varying experiences – while some puppies gobbled it down, others refused to eat it
Several reports of batches that seemed stale

customer_reviews.title: Kibble Size: Puppy Formula vs Canine Formula
customer_reviews.text: Photo comparing kibble size of Puppy Formula and Canine Formula. I couldn't find this information anywhere so I ordered a bag of each to find out.
customer_reviews.author: RBJ

customer_reviews.title: Good pug food.
customer_reviews.text: Our pug eats this food. He never has stomach issues, and is in great health. Excellent quality, and excellent price. I don't know much about dog food, but the dog seems to. He also sits on the dining room table sometimes like a big jerk, but I don't think that has anything to do with the food.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Walden

customer_reviews.title: Avoid purchasing pet food from Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: This is the same type I have been feeding my dog, but had purchased from Chewy previously. I decided to purchase from Amazon and was disappointed. My dog had bad diarrhea. My husband then went out and bought a bag from the store. We compared the two bags and while the food from both bags looked similar, unlike some other reviews I read on here, the food from the store bought bag smelled fresh and normal. The food from the Amazon bag smelled HORRIBLE, like it is rotten or something. I will no longer purchase pet food from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Xuan M.

customer_reviews.title: Beware - likely a bad batch of dog food
customer_reviews.text: Our GSD pup had been on this for a couple of months from an old bag with no problems. As soon as we opened up a new bag delivered by amazon around mid August and fed her from it, our pup got sick right away with full blown diarrhea in the middle of the night. Taste of the Wild is normally very good but I suspect there might be a bad batch from production or transport based on the high number of complaints. As usual, Amazon is great and issued a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: duckhead

customer_reviews.title: Puppy Approves!
customer_reviews.text: Made the switch from Blue Buffalo to Taste of The Wild! The vet was pleased to hear we were switching because Blue Buffalo is over priced and garbage. I couldn't find one negative thing about this brand on Google.. Blue Buffalo on the other hand.. Many bad things. Our puppy wasn't eating much before we weaned.. Now he's been eating even more! He really loves this food. I love that it's high quality and not too pricey! Just wish more stores carried their products! I also think they should occasionally have coupons available '
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Buy it at Chewy.com instead
customer_reviews.text: While I do love this food for my puppy, I do not love this price. I was able to subscribe monthly for this at Chewy.com for $40/bag. I will wait a couple extra days for shipping to save $20.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong with the July/Aug 2017 batch
customer_reviews.text: Been using TOTW for years. But something is wrong with the summer 2017 puppy batch! 7 month old puppy started having puddle-poop as soon as this bag arrived. Switched foods and she was better. Reintroduced and the diarrhea returned. Lots of similar experiences on the consumer affairs website.
customer_reviews.author: iheartmmp

customer_reviews.title: Thier coats are beautiful, they're breath isn't horrible and their bowel movements are incredible!
customer_reviews.text: We own 2 Rhodesian ridgebacks pups from two separate breeders. They're currently 86 and 77 pounds at 9 months old. We go through 90 pounds of TOTW a month and I think we need to add another bag to our Subscribe and Save because they are growing so much. Thier coats are beautiful, they're breath isn't horrible and their bowel movements are incredible. Our breed stops growing at 18 months so we'll continue to serve them the puppy formula for several more months.
customer_reviews.author: Gitchiegaya

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pooping!
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff! Lots of real ingredients without all the fillers like many other brands with their excessive use of corn. Protein content is very high, which is great for my 24 week old Stabyhoun (sporting breed). Beware if you are switching over from a less healthy food, I suggest doing it very gradually. We are a week in to the change over, 50/50 old/new, and he is pooping with vigor! Six today, up from three each of the previous two days, as his intestines clean out the old Pedigree Small Dog food.
customer_reviews.author: CRPTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Only food I give my puppies
customer_reviews.text: This food is great, just reading the ingredients can show you the quality. In most dog foods I would find in stores I could not even pronounce half of the ingredients. It is clear Taste of the Wild puts the health and nutrition of your dogs front and center. Taste - My dogs clearly love the taste, they devour this food compared to other dry food I have bought them Health - My dogs coat has improved drastically, and that is a huge indicator of the quality of food Price - A bit more expensive than other similar brands, but the quality is worth it Overall this dog food is great!
customer_reviews.author: Dove Family

customer_reviews.title: This food made my puppy sick.
customer_reviews.text: This food made my puppy vomit. The size, smell and color compared to an in-store bought bag of the same brand of food and flavor that I’ve been feeding my puppy for 6m now is WAY OFF. This bag of food contained smaller, lighter colored pebbles. After a couple of days of eating this food, my puppy was vomiting every night.
customer_reviews.author: Susie

customer_reviews.title: Causes immediate foul diarrhea.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY!!!! My dog started eating this bag 3 days ago and suddently started developing vomiting, frequent stools, and foul diarrhea. This was the only change to his diet. My dog is a large breed and almost never had an upset stomach in the past. Will never trust this brand ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Young

customer_reviews.title: a lot of fiber
customer_reviews.text: Something I like about this food is that it's been making my dog's coat look nice, but something I don't like is that this food has an unnaturally high amount of fiber. I always check my dog's poop because I think of it as a measure of his health, and with this food my dog has started having huge, really soft stools. Ive been having to mix it with other food to get his poop to the right consistency. so that sucks. I'm wondering if the adult formula would work better for him. he's almost 10 months old
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Some bags may be contaminated
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using TOTW since I brought my puppy home. Amazing food. Never had issues until now. Apparently they are having their first recall, and I found out because my dog has been having watery poop nonstop and acting funny since I opened this bag. Many others have way worse issues though over the past year. Changed to a different comparable brand and he’s back to normal.
customer_reviews.author: Casey B.

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as you'd but from the store
customer_reviews.text: So, when I buy this from Petco, my dog loves it. However, after buying two bags off Amazon, she waits till she's starving to touch it. Not sure if they are stale or a scam. The first bag, the food was smaller and darker in color than the one I had bought from the store. The only reason I got a second bag was because I forgot I put it on a subscription.
customer_reviews.author: Janet gordon

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy anything from this company ever again
customer_reviews.text: What a waste of my money! Pup does better on $5 grocery store brand puppy food than on this. I had high hopes despite the mixed reviews. This brand has lots of recalls and it's true, my pup has terrible diarrhea and stinky gas when he eats this. He does not digest this well at all and sniffs at it for a long time before eating or won't finish it. He knows it's no good. Stay away from this one and go elsewhere. There are lots of good brands out there at a similar price point. Save yourself the nightmare. Now I have an entire bag of useless kibble.
customer_reviews.author: Zina

customer_reviews.title: Puppy (and vet!) approved!
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the highest rated puppy foods on the market (reflected not only in the Amazon reviews you can see here, but also by our vet). We just adopted a Shepard mix and the rescue organization suggested no grains and no chicken. After doing EXTENSIVE research, I settled on this one. When talking with the vet at our first visit she confirmed this is one of the best (which made me relieved!). Even better, the puppy seems to really like it and eats it all up really well. Will continue to stick with this brand as he gets older. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: ALLFLUKSD

customer_reviews.title: Worked to add protein for an emaciated foster dog
customer_reviews.text: I like the ingredients in this food and feel comfortable feeding it to my beloved dogs. I mixed this in with our regular Avoderm Lamb and sweet potato kibble for a malnourished rescue dog. She was about a year old and in need of extra protein for a few weeks. The Prairie puppy formula was exactly what she needed in small pieces that mixed well with water and our other food. The pup had no digestive troubles from this food combination and happily ate it. Our foster dog has since moved on to her forever home and they are continuing with the Taste of the Wild brand.
customer_reviews.author: Dogs & Horses

customer_reviews.title: I've found my Blue Heeler Pup (6 months) is satisfied faster with this food than with the Purina Puppy ...
customer_reviews.text: I've found my Blue Heeler Pup (6 months) is satisfied faster with this food than with the Purina Puppy Chow that was given to me when I adopted him. The top few ingredients in The Puppy Chow are Whole Grain Corn, Corn Gluten Meal, and Soybean Meal. It's no wonder Rex has a strong preference for the Taste of the Wild; With the top ingredients being Buffalo, Lamb, and Sweet Potatoes! He seems to think this food is as good as many of his treats. That's saying something. I will continue to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry

customer_reviews.title: Made my dog smell terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I used to like Taste of the Wild a lot, but something changed in it last year that wasn't going well with my dog. My dog started smelling AWFUL. Like you wanted to puke awful. My boyfriend, roommates, and family all pointed it out when I brought him places. I would give him baths weekly, if not twice a week, but he would smell again within 2 days. I finally decided to see if his nutrition was the issue and switched him to a different food about 3 months ago to see if that was the problem and after a couple weeks he didn't have that putrid stench anymore. It hasn't been a problem since, even without baths. 🤷‍♀️
customer_reviews.author: PatradTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great food Picky Dog
customer_reviews.text: This is nutritionally the best in my opinion of dry dog food brands and I've done a ton of research. We have a GSD who always has to coaxed into eating but I think it's just him and not the food. We did try 2 others over past year. Fromm which was good but no difference, and Natures Complete? (I think that was it) which was not good at all noticeable skin and coat problems. I just wish he would eat this better for me and put on some more weight. But his coat is always shiny with this. Pricey but not ridiculous compared to some "premiums"
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: ... now for my dog and my cat and I’ve loved it. Recently
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using taste of the wild for years now for my dog and my cat and I’ve loved it. Recently, both have started vomiting and having diarrhea. The cat ran out of food and the store did not happen to have taste of the wild so I bought another brand and sure enough, it went away. I noticed and a few days later and switched the dog’s and hers went away as well. So I’m not sure if something has changed but I will not be purchasing again.
customer_reviews.author: Heather and Alvaro Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: I've heard so many good things about it and read lots of amazing reviews
customer_reviews.text: I had really high hopes for this dog food. I've heard so many good things about it and read lots of amazing reviews. Unfortunately, it gave our puppy loose poop which led to multiple accidents in his kennel. Not fun to clean up! After talking to our vet, he said this food is really high in protein and a few other things (that I can't remember) that can cause a lot of problems with dogs. Alas, dog food is trial and error, what works for one may not work for another
customer_reviews.author: michelletmommyTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Our German Shepherd puppy loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Gunnar, our German Shepherd, loves TOTW. We tried 4 other grain free foods and he just didn't seem to agree with them. He ate them all, but his stool was always shapeless. After checking him out at the vet (all healthy) we gave TOTW a shot and it's been great ever since. He's also put on weight and continues to enjoy this stuff. Highly recommend it. Before TOTW tried Wellness, Blue Buffalo, Blue Buffalo Basic, and Solid Gold.
customer_reviews.author: Lackey

customer_reviews.title: If you love your dog, buy it TOTW.
customer_reviews.text: Nice, small, meaty, fatty kibble, my dog loves it. If you read the label and compare the protein, fat, fiber and moisture content of TOTW to other dog food brands(I have a spreadsheet for this) you will probably be amazed by how deficient brands like Iams seem by comparison. My dog is 5.5 years old now but I still feed her this because she is extremely healthy and in good shape and seems to enjoy eating this food, without gorging herself. After 20+ years of dog ownership I doubt I will ever look for another brand of dog food unless TOTW is no longer available.
customer_reviews.author: Gnslngr

customer_reviews.title: Best Value
customer_reviews.text: This is great dog food at a fair price. It is a 4 star dog food on Dog Food Advisor (the adult food is 4.5) out of 5 stars. We wanted to avoid feeding our puppy brands such as Iams, Science Diet, etc... because they're really not that good for your pet due to all the meat by-products and grains - especially corn! After comparing similar products, we decided this was the best value overall as far as how much you get for your money vs quality. The fact that they sell this in 30lb bags for the same price as Blue Buffalo's 24lb bags was the deciding factor.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Marie

customer_reviews.title: Happy puppy/Happy owner
customer_reviews.text: Our puppy loves this food and the cat also has become a huge fan as I see him sneaking bites out of the dog dish. I am ordering for the cat fro this company, so they both have wholesome food. My 50 lb. puppy's coat is very shiny and bathroom nuggets seem to be less then with the cheaper brand we were using prior. Highly recommend. Only down fall is the nuggets are super small and I was hoping for larger nuggets as I did order for a large breed. Find tiny pieces all over the floor as we have a nibbler/wanderer type eater.
customer_reviews.author: Traci Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Just beware buying this from amazon
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it's the offbrand kind aka knockoff! But my german shepherd puppy started to have blood in his bowel movements and had to force himself to eat it. Switched his puppy food now he's better !
customer_reviews.author: Pinkbow80

customer_reviews.title: I loved it, Puppy wasnt the biggest fan for its taste.
customer_reviews.text: This food is pretty expensive so I figured I would drop my review in. I enjoyed buying it for my puppy because I knew how high quality it is, but if my pup was dishing out this review it would just be average. He wont eat all of it in the morning or evening and prefers something else over it. My dad trice NUTRO and when I mixed it in with TOTW he would only eat the NUTRO food. If you dog loves it and enhales it then stick with it, but ill be trying something different in the near future.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: My dog loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves this food. I’ve read some bad reviews on here but I’m on my second 30 lbs bag and have had no problems with my pup (as far as I know). Switching him to this food was easy. He had some diarrhea at first but that’s common when switching their diet. He is perfectly fine and hasn’t had any problems since the first week. He loves it. I’ll probably stay with TOTW when I switch him to adult food.
customer_reviews.author: MJ

customer_reviews.title: Having good, quality dog food delivered right to my door ...
customer_reviews.text: Having good, quality dog food delivered right to my door (on Amazon's Subscribe & Save) is AMAZING! No more forgetting to get dog food & having to run out in the middle of the night to pick some up & then having to lug a heavy bag to the door! We used to buy Blue Buffalo from the vet's office & this is a much better value (& probably better quality). The dogs love it & I feel good knowing they are eating some of the best food available.
customer_reviews.author: Chris O'Brien

customer_reviews.title: Yummy
customer_reviews.text: This dry food soothed my new puppy's nervous stomach when I was trying to transition from the adult food he had been fed before I adopted him. His coat is so shiny that he gets compliments on the street, and his poos are very regular and appear to come out very nicely and are easy to pick up. There's no way to be sure but it seems like a high quality food to me! And of course pup loves the taste and will sit and throw his paw at me every meal time.
customer_reviews.author: MroTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Not the same as store bought.
customer_reviews.text: My puppies loved this when we bought it from PS. Bought on Amazon since I thought it was the same as you’d buy in the store..... My puppies won’t eat it and it made one of my puppies sick. Diarrhea and vomiting. I feel awful. Wish I would have read the reviews. Sad it’s not the same as what you get at the store. Stick to buying locally.
customer_reviews.author: Sblandford

customer_reviews.title: Best dog food I've ever bought HANDS DOWN
customer_reviews.text: Best dog food I've ever bought (especially for the price!). My dogs (2 boxers) are ALWAYS EXCITED to eat this. Most foods from stores would give them diarrhea and when I poured it in the bowl they would look at me like "WTF is this s***?!?!". Yeah, they love this stuff. They've got tons of energy and seem very content with it.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Brooks

customer_reviews.title: My pup is bored of this food now which is normal so I ...
customer_reviews.text: My pup transitioned to this food and he likes it. It doesn’t upset his stomach or give him any kind of allergic reaction. His poops are also normal and predictable. One thing I will say is that my dog is a bit underweight and this food doesn’t quite help. My pup is bored of this food now which is normal so I recommend buying a smaller quantity to see if it sticks for your dog before splurging on a large bag.
customer_reviews.author: Bambi Eyes

customer_reviews.title: Dog tested - Mom approved.
customer_reviews.text: After carefully reviewing the contents on the label, I got a bag of Venison/Bison at a farm store a few years ago. Our Saint Bernard loves it - and it keeps her happy, healthy and her coat all soft and shiny. WIth some trepidation after reading some of the reviews here, we ordered it from Amazon on Subscribe and Save. I am pleased to report that all bags are the same great quality as that from the store. We recently adopted a Catahoula puppy and now we all are loving it.
customer_reviews.author: TundraBee

customer_reviews.title: Great Food
customer_reviews.text: This food is great for my Standard Poodle puppy. He don't eat as much as he did on regular puppy food, and potty time is much better by being less and not as often. I am just starting on my second 30lb bag, and wouldn't switch for anything. Follow up, just finishing second bag, and I just can't say enough good things about this food. I am so glad I found TOTW puppy formula. My puppy is growing by leaps and bounds, and Vet is amazed at how he is progressing. Love this food for my pupster!!!!! My puppy has access to his food all day, I give him free range on food and water.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley Burch

customer_reviews.title: great value option alternative from Fromm
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this food as a value replacement for Fromm food which we were feeding our dog before, Fromm is great, but extremely expensive, taste of the wild seems to be really good, but also is not as expensive as Fromm. to us seems like a great value replacement. Have gotten a couple of bags of this now and our dog ( border collie/ Dalmation/ Boxer) really seems to like it, her coat looks shiny and she seems very healthy. highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel Kachmar

customer_reviews.title: Ingredients checm
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but with a great product there comes a high price. I dont like the price. It is not my dogs daily meal but they do enjoy it and I buy it every now and then. I would buy it more often if I had more money. So if you got the money go for it.
customer_reviews.author: ladyflame

customer_reviews.title: Bad Bag
customer_reviews.text: My puppy did well on the first bag of this food and on this bag he is having diarrhea! I should have believed the other reviews about the inconsistent quality of this food. I would not recommend this food whatsoever. All the dogs love this food and gobble it up but diarrhea is not healthy!
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: its a better deal. We vary the flavors
customer_reviews.text: The nearest store that stocks this brand is a farm/ranch store in a town thats 20 minutes each way. Amazon pricing is slightly less, and with prime delivery, its a better deal. We vary the flavors, but this is what we feed our two large dogs (1 year old pit and 3 year old pit mix) We did the research, and of all the premium grainless or carbless foods, this had the best reviews from both professionals and pet owners.
customer_reviews.author: JPDL

customer_reviews.title: My Labrador & a Beagle loved it but I noticed they were looking for food ...
customer_reviews.text: My Labrador & a Beagle loved it but I noticed they were looking for food a few hours later. Didn't cause any gas or upset stomach but I did go back to their old brand because it didn't seem to fill them up. They are feed twice a day.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Nutritional dog food
customer_reviews.text: I’ve done my research on dog foods. I used to have a blue pitbull, and she inspired me to give her the best life possible. I love taste of the wild. My dogs have fit, lean muscles. And have more energy than I could ever handle by myself.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica jamison

customer_reviews.title: Happy puppy
customer_reviews.text: I searched all over for a puppy formula with fish as its only protein source and was very excited to find it here. Unfortunately, they couple the option of buying this with the option of buying bison & venison mox.. either i messed up the order or amazon did, because i unknowlingly ended up feeding my puppy the bison kind. This is the first dog food hes ever eaten without being coaxed. He LOVES it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessa Exley

customer_reviews.title: Best for our Bullie
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my English Bulldog puppy to transition him off of Royal Canin, which had his stool and his gas smelling very badly, so we were looking for something to help with that. After doing some research, and talking with the breeder that we bought him from, we came down to choosing between this and Frommes, and after trying a sample of Frommes and a sample of this, we chose this brand. He has been on it for about a week, and he has had none of the gastrointestinal issues that we observed with the Royal Canin. I would definitely suggest this.
customer_reviews.author: danikat

customer_reviews.title: Border collie pup eats it in no time
customer_reviews.text: My 5 month old male border collie has been eating this brand for a couple of months now and he gobbles it up. The kibble is small for the size that he is now (medium), so we may end up switching to the adult formula. I am glad that the food is grain free and it doesn't smell bad at all. It is a bit greasy, but then again most dry dog food has that oily grease feel. It also looks like it has a bit of salt on each kibble piece but it obviously needs to be preserved somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Aeruna

customer_reviews.title: Shipping is terrible on 30lb bags.
customer_reviews.text: Our German Shepard, loves the food. However, delivery for a 30lbs. bag is always terrible. We have to purchase a small 15lb. bag to get us by while we wait for the 30lb bag. This happens every time we order the large bag. Our poor boy was without food for a couple of days. And then had diarrhea with the supplement food we gave him. Fix the shipping on 30lb bag. 15lb bag has very quick delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Pearl

customer_reviews.title: I feel like this food is really good for my puppy
customer_reviews.text: I feel like this food is really good for my puppy. At first it gave her terrible runs. But I think her system had to get used to it. And she was a 12 weeks old so they have runny poops at that age anyways. Now she is 11 months and has totally normal poops. She wrong healthy and growing big. She is a Siberian husky and eats about one bag a month. I will transition her to regular taste of the wild dog-food when she hits 2 years-old. I would definitely recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Marshay Le Prey

customer_reviews.title: I bought this food for our English Bulldog because they ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food for our English Bulldog because they are susceptible to skin allergies. Amazon is my "go to" for reviews and everyone said that this was very helpful for the skin allergies with their dogs. He had only been using it for a couple of weeks, but he loves it and I definitely see some improvement in his overall skin quality. To be fair, he had a skin infection recently so he has also been on antibiotics, but he has only been taking them for the last 2 days.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime S.

customer_reviews.title: Great puppy food, affordable Amazon pricing
customer_reviews.text: I'm happy with this food for my puppy. It's been rated as a high-quality puppy food, made in the USA. It's clean ingredient list, use of hormone and antibiotic-free meats, grain-free guarantee, and ethoxyquin-free preservation techniques makes me feel good about what I'm feeding her. Amazon's price makes it affordable and I will continue to feed my puppy this food AND continue to order it for the great price on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hofmann

customer_reviews.title: great food & great ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: got this food for my new puppy- her foster mom recommended it. love the ingredients. and my puppy loves it too! I use the same brand's canned wet food mixed into her breakfast. also with a drizzle of coconut oil to keep her fur and skin happy and healthy. (do some research on adding coconut oil to your dog's food first- you need to start with a very small amount of oil and slowly increase the amount- depending on the size of your dog)
customer_reviews.author: Brenna Bear

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a few different bags of this food. My dog won't even eat the adult food. And everytime both my dogs eat the puppy one they throw up. Since buying it from amazon my dogs have been throwing up! Never had any issues buying it local! Idk what they are selling but it makes my dogs sick. Have huge 30 pound bags left! I won't even feed my dogs this anymore from amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Degala

customer_reviews.title: Food makes our puppies have diarrhea. Puppies were reluctant ...
customer_reviews.text: Food makes our puppies have diarrhea. Puppies were reluctant to eat and we’ve also seen them get up more to go to the bathroom as opposed to other foods that we have tried. Product came delivered as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Margas

customer_reviews.title: Our Chihuahua loves this Small Bite Food!
customer_reviews.text: This is our go to dog food for our Two year old Chihuaha. Small bite size and he can't wait to wolf it down. He can be picky, but not when it comes to Taste of the Wild. We have to watch his much older sister, b/c she will try to eat his puppy food if not monitored. This food has been easy on his stomach and we love the fact that is ships free on Amazon Prime!
customer_reviews.author: HWT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent results
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. My 2 month old rescue puppy was being fed Hill's Science Diet when I got him; the food stank and made him smell bad, too. After some research, I decided to switch to a food with a higher protein content, and TOTW was a pretty affordable option. We couldn't be happier. Puppy smells good, his coat shines, and he always has lots of energy. He's a doxie/beagle/pit mix, about 38 lbs, 1 year old now, and he eats about 2 cups of this stuff a day. Will definitely be trying the adult version of TOTW next!
customer_reviews.author: Ebsa

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Dog Food, But Caused Loose Stool & Toxic Farts in my Puppies (High Prairie Formula)
customer_reviews.text: I switched my large breed puppies from the Pacific Stream formula because they didn't like the taste of it. Although this is high quality dog food, it didn't work for my dogs at all! They started to get loose stool again and their farts were toxic! That is what I was trying to get them off when I switched to Taste of the Wild and Pacific Stream accomplished that, whereas the High Prairie formula made it all come back.
customer_reviews.author: Vivien M.

customer_reviews.title: High quality dog food, without the high price tag
customer_reviews.text: I love this stuff. Our dog has stomach issues so we have to give her high-quality food. This is high-quality food without the high price tag!! Truly a great price for high-quality dog food. This has no meat byproducts or other bad additives, and is grain-free. My only minor complaint is that the bag does not have a zipper so you can't close it once you open it; so I had to buy a storage container for the food (which is fine anyways cuz it keeps mice out and keeps the food fresh). Great food, great price.
customer_reviews.author: Chris D. Leister

customer_reviews.title: Puppy eats it, and it's supposed to be good for her
customer_reviews.text: Read a lot of reviews, and this kibble seemed to get very good marks. Puppy likes it a lot, and the amount of poop seems to be minimized over what is generated by cheaper food.
customer_reviews.author: S. McClain

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for my dog
customer_reviews.text: My 10 month old German shepherd boy does not eat this food for some reason. On the first day, he eat a little. From the second day and on, he completely refused to eat this food. I was careful mixing up his old and this new food proportionally during the transition period. Unfortunately this dog food does not work for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: My puppy absolutely loves this food.
customer_reviews.text: My puppy has been eating this food since the beginning. I wanted to feed him a high quality, grain free food. He is a Great Dane and is currently eating about 5 cups of food a day. The price is reasonable enough that voracious eating doesn't break the bank. I recommend this food highly for anyone searching for a good puppy kibble option. I have tons of friends that also feed their pets Taste of The Wild and have never heard a bad word about it.
customer_reviews.author: Erica B

customer_reviews.title: Best puppy formula for my Australian German Shepherd.
customer_reviews.text: My German Aussie freaking loves this stuff! He was hesitant with the Blue Wilderness Puppy formula I purchased, which cost all of $56 bucks at petsmart, but the second I weened him off of it and onto this, he hasn't hesitated to eat his meals. He's looking better, his coat is nice and soft. His blacks are deep black, golds are nice and golden, and his whites are the whitest I've seen on him, yet! I vouche for you to make this purchase. Don't hesitate. This is worth every penny and your dog will love you for it.
customer_reviews.author: Kingdcoy

customer_reviews.title: This is supposed to be great food, I know that
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be great food, I know that. The ingredients are pretty good, thus the 3 stars. But, it didn't work for us. It gave our GSD puppy horrible diarrhea. Even just mixing a very small amount with the food he was eating to transition him caused us to be up every 15 minutes to take him out all night long. The vet suggested mixing it with a chicken and rice bland diet to transition him and that STILL caused diarrhea. We gave up and started trying the bland mix with Nutro Ultra, which worked much better and he transitioned to that fine.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Quality puppy food - mastiff approved
customer_reviews.text: Love this product and the several adult varieties as well. This has taken a rather gangly, thin 60-lb rescue puppy to a happy, healthy, tall and strong 130-pound cane corso - no issues at all. I also feed the adult varieties to two other large dogs and am very pleased all the way around. Both for price and quality, this is the hands-down winner of grain-free dry dog food. Plus, how great is that to get it delivered to your door rather than lugging home from the store (where it actually costs more than on-line - another mystery of life).
customer_reviews.author: J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent ingredients, high quality, worth every dollar for my puppy!
customer_reviews.text: This food was recommended by my breeder and although my puppy knows no other food it definitely meets his needs. From the ingredient list to the mass quantity I can buy I am very happy. It is lovely to be able to order this food then thanks to Amazon Prime it is delivered right to my door two days later. This food is a little more expensive than other high quality foods but read the ingredient list and benefits and the few dollars extra make it worth everything! Excited to try the other flavors to see what he likes best but for now am limited to puppy food!
customer_reviews.author: Jennie D.

customer_reviews.title: Dogs are the judge - This food is Guilty of being delicious
customer_reviews.text: My dogs love it!! They were eating Blue buffalo wilderness before this food. Now they turn their nose up at blue buffalo. Not knocking blue buffalo as their products are amazing and top of the line. (especially their wilderness foods) The kibble is really small though. If you have a large breed I feel they will outgrow this kibble size really quick.
customer_reviews.author: Travis S.

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware - high levels of heavy metals
customer_reviews.text: This dog food is toxic. It has VERY high levels of heavy metals - arsenic, bpa, cadmum, mercury, and lead. Google Taste of the Wild lawsuit and you can see there is already a class action lawsuit against this company filed August 2018. If you love your dog, stick to something cleaner such as brands from Canada that have higher food standards that trickle down to dog foods.
customer_reviews.author: Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Our dogs love it
customer_reviews.text: Been feeding this since our pup could chew feed. Beautiful coat, no issues eating. No gas! Dog poots are the worst!!! It's spendy, but to be honest, when I tried another high quality puppy food to save a buck, they wanted more so the savings was negated.
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost for geriatric dogs also
customer_reviews.text: Our "pup" is actually 14 years old, but we were having a hard time keeping any weight on him. He's a finicky eater and has always had a sensitive stomach. He really likes the taste of this feed and the higher protein formula of the puppy feed helps us keep his weight at a healthy level. Yes, it's more expensive than other options, but it's worth it to us when all factors are taken into consideration. Will definitely continue to use in the future.
customer_reviews.author: lk

customer_reviews.title: My puppy just wasn't crazy about this!
customer_reviews.text: We put our 2 month old pit on this food after hearing so many great reviews on Taste of the Wild. I even bought the big bag because I was confident it would be a hit. Our puppy just didn't seem to care for it too much. She was eating less on it than she was on her previous food. We only tried fhis flavor so we may have had better luck with others.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this dog food
customer_reviews.text: I really like this dog food. My dog has been itchy/scratchy through most seasons. I recently decided to try an all natural diet to see if that might help. While it did temporarily, nothing helped as much as TotW. Yes, she still itches. No, it isn't a magical product. But so far it's the only thing that has made it manageable. The kibble is very small, maybe pea shaped; and I believe my pup likes the flavor. This is best deal for TotW I've found; only on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah L. Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Dog refuses to eat this flavor
customer_reviews.text: I tried for almost a month to get my dog to eat this food, as I've ordered a different flavor before and had no problems. My dog refuses to eat this flavor, and it has given her a skin rash when I finally got her to eat a bit of it the last 2 days after trying the oil trick. Again. I think it's just the flavor that she is reacting to.
customer_reviews.author: b00bzi11a

customer_reviews.title: Was not a good food for my dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this food hoping that it would provide better health for my dogs. They were previously on Science Diet which has grain in it. I have done a lot of reading and research on how grain is not good for animals. I heard nothing but rave reviews about this dog food in particular. So I made the switch. I am not pleased. We have gone through a 30 lb bag of the food and my dogs have had nothing but runny awful smelling bowl movements from the get go. They have also been going a lot more frequently. I do not see any improvement in their overall health. I will be switching back to Science Diet.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Leisinger

customer_reviews.title: Not good for pups with allergies.
customer_reviews.text: To preface this, I have a blue nose pit puppy, she has terrible allergies and this is another food in a long line of food that does not help her allergies. Unfortunately this one caused more itching and scratching and caught an infection (not from the food but in the open wounds she scratched from the allergies).
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Chihuahuas and Chihuahua puppies really like it
customer_reviews.text: I feel good giving the pets premium quality good without any carbs or fillers. I am s vegetarian myself but give animal Protein to my dogs. They show a distinct preference for this food compared to standard kibble. Put milk on it for younger puppies to help them wean. All of the dogs like it. Pleasant smell. Good price discount through Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: QuinnTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great food for my Staffie pup
customer_reviews.text: The bits are small for his growing mouth and he loves it so much. He takes his time to chew it and seems to really enjoy it. I can even use this food as training treats because he loves it so much. He seems to have a strong stomach and enjoys all foods. If you have a pup with a sensitive tummy try the same brand except use the Pacific Salmon recipe. I won't be switching brands as my puppy loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Boyer

customer_reviews.title: Great dog food, WAY too pricey
customer_reviews.text: The dogs love this food, yet it leaves their breath smelling like yuck (I guess the same can be said of any other dog food). The salmon is even worse. My big complaint about this food is the cost; it is incredibly expensive, which I find unappealing. I've found that Costco makes an organic dog food, that costs significantly less than this, ergo the switch to that.
customer_reviews.author: lapis lazuli

customer_reviews.title: If your dog has Allergies Try this!
customer_reviews.text: I switched to TOTW after my last dog showed signs of an allergic reaction to his last food (Also a high quality known brand). I figured to go Grain free and with a product that wouldn't break the bank so to speak. I have heard nothing but good from this brand of food so I decided to test it out. After a month on the food signs of allergy alleviated and fallen fur was growing back. I now use TOTW for all my dogs and future dogs. The puppy kind has smaller bites than the adult which make it easier for smaller mouths. I know they make a cat kind as well but I've yet to try such.
customer_reviews.author: Mercedes

customer_reviews.title: Ask vet for portions
customer_reviews.text: I adopted a 14 week old pup and started feeding her this. She loved it and I was following the guidelines on feeding on the bag. However her now turning 6 months has become very disinterested in the food. Be wary of the feeding guidelines and ask your vet. Went to vet who did a calorie count to find she only needed 2 cups / day versus the 3- 3 2/3 listed on package.
customer_reviews.author: Cint

customer_reviews.title: Golden retriever loves it
customer_reviews.text: We use this as food and treats. She loves being placed in her crate with a kong full of this food topped with 1 t of natural peanut butter. This review is for B006BU77E0 High Prairie puppy venison and bison
customer_reviews.author: ron k.

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff!
customer_reviews.text: My pup loves this food! She was eating the Salmon flavor before this and was a pretty picky eater. Immediately after switching she was in love with this and didn't upset her sensitive tummy at all. She has adjusted and isn't as enthusiastic about eating anymore, but she still tends to eat more than she did with the salmon. The quality is great and the ingredients make me feel good about giving it to my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Dalton Miller

customer_reviews.title: Solid choice
customer_reviews.text: No issues. My dog loves the flavor and I feel like it's a quality product as it doesn't produce any stomach digestive problems. Her waste is not excessive, due to the lack of fillers, not hard, not too soft but just right.
customer_reviews.author: HowdagerTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great, healthy product!
customer_reviews.text: The pricing on this is fair, saves a few dollars compared to local pet stores, and with Amazon Prime it is a steal. My Shepard mix 9month puppy loves this formula. He eats it up just fine, doesn't seem to bother him on consistency of the food. When he goes to potty he doesn't seem to have any troubles at all. The waste is also a good mix of softness but hard enough to pick up without spreading all over the grass or bags. I would recommend it a try. I love that it uses all good ingredients. My puppy is family to me and I'm glad I'm feeding him the good stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Tony Chau

customer_reviews.title: Love It! (Boykin Spaniel Owner)
customer_reviews.text: After extensive reading and speaking with breeders decided to give this brand a try. It did not disappoint. We have a female Boykin Spaniel and she LOVES this food. It has helped with regulating her need to use the bathroom frequently. We have seen her coat grow thicker. It's been a really great switch and I tell all my pet owner friends about this brand. Barring something unexpected we will be Taste of the Wild customers for life!
customer_reviews.author: Holly Weiss

customer_reviews.title: good product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Many people say their dog ate this right up...mine did not. He eats the same amount as he did with his previous food and doesn't seem to care one way or the other. I do care, however, and feel that grain free is best due to his allergies. I will continue to pay the high price because it's still less expensive than other grain free brands. I haven't noticed much difference except that he seems to be properly digesting the product without issues.
customer_reviews.author: Pauline

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended for Boston Terrier
customer_reviews.text: For the first 2 months of my Boston Terrier's life he ate what the breeder gave us which was not great quality. As a result my Boston had horrible gas as that breed is known to have. Boy was it bad! A lot of people on a Boston Terrier Facebook page recommended this brand of food. So I got this and as I slowly started to integrate it with his old food I noticed he didn't have as bad gas and he LOVED the taste. He has been on this food for 6 months now and very rarely has any gas (most only if dad gives him too many treats). And he is very happy and healthy!
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Great Puppy Food!
customer_reviews.text: My little Lab mix Sam loves this kibble! Size is good for meals and as a training treat. His stools are a great consistency especially compared to the food he was previously eating. I think that has helped his potty training significantly. Also, appreciate the low calcium content to help ward off hip and joint issues latter in his life. I would recommend this to any larger breed puppies with an active lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob M. King

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding this food to my new English Bulldog puppy for about a month now and he seems to love it. For the first week or two, his stool was soft, but now his body has fully adjusted to it and everything is great. His fur is super soft and shiny and he's growing like a weed. It is very important to me to feed my dogs healthy food so after plenty of research I chose this grain-free option and I'm glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Laura Winter

customer_reviews.title: Top quality nutrition and quality ingredients.
customer_reviews.text: You can not beat this brand and recipe for nutrition and high quality ingredients-- I've done my homework. On top of that, the price is unbeatable! Do you homework and compare with other top brands like Blue Buffalo, Orijen, etc. This order, for me, is faster and cheaper on amazon than buying at my local boutique pet store.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Chocolate lab's favorite food!
customer_reviews.text: My chocolate lab LOVES Taste of the Wild. So many dog foods these days that are high in grain and low quality fillers- after scouring the internet for ingredients in a ton of different brands, we chose TOTW, but it was a close decision with Blue Buffalo. The price on Amazon can't be beat, and my lab's coat looks shinier and healthier after we switched him from the Eukanuba food the breeder had him on. He is a healthy 80 lb teenager now who has upgraded to the adult version of this. Only the best for our fur-children!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Schalkoff

customer_reviews.title: Best Food Ever!
customer_reviews.text: I love the ingredients of TOTW, my pup likes it and it is very good for her. As far as it NOT being the same product sold in stores, I disagree with you who said that. I bought both, compared them side by side...THE SAME FOOD!
customer_reviews.author: Jen38

customer_reviews.title: GI problems
customer_reviews.text: Since switching to This brand our puppy now has been suffering from vomiting, excessive gas and increased thirst. She also no longer interested in eating the food.
customer_reviews.author: Casey  Watson

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what all the naysayers are talking about, but my dog loves this food and has no problem with digesting it etc. I'm ordering another bag today
customer_reviews.author: zeph

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying to man & beast
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with Taste of the Wild puppy food. The ingrediants are all natural, no grain, etc. We switched from Blue Buffalo and previously Science. This food smells better dry, there seems to be less volume of dog waste, certainly less odor & he now rarely has gas. Our dog enjoys it and seems to be thriving. I wish this company also made biscuits and training treats.
customer_reviews.author: Tom St.C

customer_reviews.title: Definitely using this dog food
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical at first when the breeder told us that this was what she was using. After tons of research, this food is really high quality and I'm very happy with it. Our puppy has maintained a healthy weight and her coat is really shiny. This is a food that we will continue to feed her.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Order from somewhere else
customer_reviews.text: I had been feeding my dog this for months. I ordered from Amazon because I needed it fast, and it made her sick. I stopped feeding her it and I ordered a bag from Chewy and compared the kibbles, and they were CLEARLY different sizes. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: but so far my dog seems to do best with this one
customer_reviews.text: Tried a few other fancy dog foods, but so far my dog seems to do best with this one. Probably depends on the dog though. My 1 year old Cavalier seems to like it fine.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: he seems to be doing much better. He has put on some weight and has ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this ny accident. I usually order the adult High Prairie formula (rated 5 stars on dogfoodadvisor.com). This time i somehow ordered the puppy formula (4 star rating on dogfoodadvisor.com). The oldest of our 3 dogs is a husky pushing 13. Since we gave him this puppy formula, he seems to be doing much better. He has put on some weight and has much more energy. We have decided to keep him on the puppy formula for as long as we have him.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky

customer_reviews.title: Puppy (11 week old Chocolate lab) was fine on previous food given to us by first owner
customer_reviews.text: Puppy (11 week old Chocolate lab) was fine on previous food given to us by first owner. They gave us some of the previous food, but in a different bag so I wasn't sure what he had been using. This brand was pricey, but had high praise so I thought I'd give it a try. Unfortunately, the puppy has had diarrhea the past 3 weeks while using this. At first I though maybe it was just the transition, but after almost a month, there has been no improvement. I'm not sure if it's the food or a bad batch that was recalled. Waste of money and will discontinue.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: 7 Week Old Boxer Puppy Approved.
customer_reviews.text: My 7 week old Boxer Puppy thinks this stuff is tasty! We feed Taste of the Wild to our adult dog as well and figured we would try the puppy formula out. She was weened with Puppy Chow (yuck) and we mixed Puppy Chow and TotW Puppy Formula for exactly 1 feeding. She pushed the Puppy Chow out of the way to get to the Taste of the Wild food. We suspected she might like it because she kept getting into our adult dogs stash and sneaking bits of it. No problems at all with her stool or tolerance since the switch.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: I like this dog food
customer_reviews.text: I like this dog food, the size of the pellet is ok for our puppies, but again who knows if this stuff is really good for our dogs. I brought it because of the reviews and the dogs seem to really like it and after a month they seem to be putting on weight
customer_reviews.author: simpleperson

product_meta.title: Taste of The Wild Grain Free High Protein Dry Dog Food High Prairie Puppy - Venison & Bison
product_meta.description: Size:30lb - DiscontinuedModern science proves that your puppy shares the DNA of the wolf. Years of domestication and excellent care have turned your puppy from a short-lived potential foe to a long-lived best friend. Although their DNA remains the same and their tastes demand something of the wild, feed your puppy with all the proper ingredients and nutrition they need to thrive.. This grain-free formula provides digestible energy and excellent nutrition for your growing puppy. Made with real roasted meat and a blend of protein sources, this hearty formula offers a taste sensation like no other. Vegetables and fruits deliver antioxidants to help support a healthy lifestyle. Your puppy craves a taste of the wild. Go ahead and give them one.
feature_bullets: A taste of the wild with ROASTED BISON & VENISON; REAL MEAT is #1 ingredient; optimal amino acid profile & protein rich for LEAN, STRONG MUSCLES
HIGH quality PROTEIN recipe with smaller kibble; tailored for growing puppy; SUPERFOODS for hard-working ANTIOXIDANTS; DHA for BRAIN & VISION
Ingredients From Trusted, Sustainable Sources Around The World; Made With No Grain, Corn, Wheat, Filler; No Artificial Flavors, Colors, Preservatives Added
High protein ingredients with added vitamins & minerals; Nutrient rich and HIGHLY DIGESTABLE with guaranteed soecies-specific, PROPRIETARY PROBIOTICS
MADE in the USA; FAMILY OWNED & run; food made with scientifically advanced food safety protocols; We'd appreciate your CALL 800.342.4808

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
